metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
[William Heath to Colonel Gallop [Gallup?]
January 29, 1777
[RvW Box 1 Folder 30; MSS. – A.N.]]

Sir	Williams. Jan.ry 29th. 1777
You will take Charge of the
Boats lately Brought to Nw Rochelle
Posting a Proper Guard to protect
them. Mr. Richards who Came Down
with them will stay with two men 
that Came with, him to take Care of 
of [sic] them – I desire that you would
keep a Good look out to the Sound
and let me know every movment [sic]
that is made by the ships that is worthy
of notice –
I am Sr. [Sir] your Humble Servt [Servant]
W [William] Heath
Colo. [Colonel] [Colonel] Gallop
P.S. you will Draw Provisions [and]c for the
men who Came in the Boats  
[End Right Page]                         
[seal]
[Endorsed sideways:] Military Papers
[Addressed:]           To
Colonel Gallop
att
NRochell[e]
[seal]
[End Left Page]
